pullRequest.body:
add variations of `PartitionOfUnity` and Urysohn's lemma:
- In a locally compact T2 space `X`, for a compact set `t` and a finite family of open sets `{s i}` such that `t ⊆ ⋃ i, s i`, there is a family of continuous function `{f i}` supported in `s i`, `∑ i, f i x = 1` on `t` and `0 ≤ f x ≤ 1`. 
- In a locally compact regular space `X`, for a compact set `t` and a closed set `s` that are disjoint, there is a continuous function `f` with compact support which is `1` on `t` and `0` on `s` and `f x Icc (0 : ℝ) 1 ` for all `x`.

The former is formalized as a partition of unity. For this purpose, I extended `PartialRefiment` to include a predicate `p` about the refined set. With this, we can require that the refined open set has a compact closure. This can be applied when `X` is locally compact and T2.
 
These variations are needed in order to prove that [rieszContentAux](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Integral/RieszMarkovKakutani.html#rieszContentAux) is indeed a Borel measure (following Rudin "Real and complex analysis"), now in #18775.

---

The part using `prod_mem` is suggested by @eric-wieser.

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```

</details>

This PR looks mostly fine, but there are still some places where it needs some work. Are you planning to continue working on this PR? Would you like some help from others, or do you want to hand it over completely? (In the latter case, please label it with `please-adopt`.)
Are the results in `PartitionOfUnity` useful for you to use instead of these new lemmas?
Great to see this moving! Here are a few cosmetic comments
Can you extract this to a standalone `unitInterval.prod_mem` theorem in the other file?
sure, done.

This is a lot of new imports. Please move the new contents to a new file. 

Also, pleasure use `#min_imports` at the bottom of the file to minimize imports.
I reduced the imports with `#min_imports`. Should I still move the new contents to a new file?

please indent proofs 2 spaces. Also use dot-notation here 
```suggestion
  obtain ⟨U, V, hUV⟩ := normal_separation hs.isClosed_compl ht
```
Also break up `hUV` in more hypotheses (and please do these things throughout your other proofs as well).

Can you (first) prove a lemma for the complement of `s` (i.e. assume `s` is closed, disjoint with `t` and conclude that `tsupport f` is disjoint from `s`). All other Urysohn's lemmas are formulated that way.

sorry, I noticed that this lemma with `NormalSpace` replaced by `T2Space` and `LocallyCompactSpace` is essentially proven above as `exists_continuous_one_zero_of_isCompact` under `RegularSpace` and `LocallyCompactSpace`, so I removed it.

```suggestion
lemma exists_forall_tsupport_iUnion_one_iUnion_of_isOpen_isClosed [T4Space X]
```
More importantly: how does this relate to the results about partitions of unity, e.g. `exists_isSubordinate_of_locallyFinite` in `Topology.PartitionOfUnity`? That seems more general.

thank you for your review!
sorry that it took me a while and that the intention of this PR wasn't unclear. Here I wanted to remove `T4Space` (`NormalSpace`) using #12459. `exists_isSubordinate_of_locallyFinite` in `Topology.PartitionOfUnity` depends on `NormapSpace`, so I cannot do it usisng partition of unity. Does this make sense? If so, I continue editing this PR.
Ah, if you weaken the assumptions here to `T2Space` then that is valuable.

While the proof of `BumpCovering.exists_isSubordinate_of_locallyFinite_of_prop` needs `NormalSpace X` to get a subcovering with some properties, you can use the rest of the results (e.g., `BumpCovering.toPartitionOfUnity`) to simplify your proof. BTW, is `[R1Space X]` enough or you need `[T2Space X]`?
Also, please reformulate the result as existence of a `PartitionOfUnity` subordinate to your covering. This will work much better with the rest of the library.

@urkud I tried to use `PartitionOfUnity` (in the file `PartitionOfUnity.lean`), but even the trivial case gets very long, I am sure this is not what you intended but I don't know how to do it. Could you help? Do you mean to prove basic lemmas using `R1Space` `LocallyCompactSpace` instead of `NormalSpace` `ParacompactSpace`?
I'm going to have a look tomorrow.

```suggestion
family of open sets `{s i}_i` such that `t ⊆ ⋃ i, s i`, there is a family of continuous function
```
This shouldn't be a `simp` lemma: `DFunLike.coe` is the simp normal form, not `toFun`.
sorry, I removed `simp`
This lemma should be stated in the other direction as `toFun_eq_coe`, and tagged `@[simp]`.
ah I see! done
Could you please cherry-pick changes to this file to a new PR? Then we can already merge this part (with the only change: make this lemma protected).
sure. done #17844
Is it just [exists_open_between_and_isCompact_closure](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Separation.html#exists_open_between_and_isCompact_closure)?

oh yes, I didn't notice that.

What do you think of the sketch of a proof of a shrinking lemma below? I would have to use an induction over a finite set, for which I would have to find the right APIs...
done with the shrinking lemma.

@fpvandoorn I tried to make `PartitionOfFunction` through `BumpCovering`. The current problem is that [BumpCovering.exists_isSubordinate_of_locallyFinite_of_prop](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/PartitionOfUnity.html#BumpCovering.exists_isSubordinate_of_locallyFinite_of_prop) depends on `NormalSpace X` through [exists_subset_iUnion_closure_subset](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ShrinkingLemma.html#exists_subset_iUnion_closure_subset). While I could write a variation of [ShrinkingLemma.PartialRefinement.exists_gt](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ShrinkingLemma.html#ShrinkingLemma.PartialRefinement.exists_gt), I don't know how to assure that the maximal element has relatively compact open covers, except duplicating all the API's with that condition. How should I proceed?
@urkud @fpvandoorn I think I'm done with `PartitionOfUnity`.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma toFun_eq_coe : f.toFun i = f := rfl
```
Can you explain this example witha docqtring?

I made it a theorem and added a docstring, although I am not sure where this should be and whether it follows the naming convention correctly.

Actually this is the theorem I wanted to add. Then it is required to formulate it as a theorem on `PartitionOfUnity`, so I did it, but API of `PartitionOfUnity` is not directly usable in my case #12290 https://github.com/yoh-tanimoto/mathlib4/blob/yoh/yoh/RMK/linearRMK.lean

```suggestion
  p_refined {i} (hi : i ∈ carrier) : p (toFun i)
```

```suggestion
  p_refined {i} hi := by
```

```suggestion
/-- In a locally compact Hausdorff space `X`, if `s` is a compact set, `v` is a partial refinement,
```

```suggestion
    have (j) (hj : j ≠ i) : x ∉ v j := by
```

```suggestion
    obtain rfl : j = i := by
```

```suggestion
  refine ⟨⟨update v i vi, insert i v.carrier, ?_, ?_, ?_, ?_, ?_⟩, ⟨?_, ?_⟩, ?_⟩
```

```suggestion
is contained in the corresponding original open set. -/
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

The line of sight rule is useful here for clarity, namely keep the main branch of your code unindented
```suggestion
  intro i x
  constructor
  · exact f.nonneg' i x
  by_cases h0 : f i x = 0
  · rw [h0]
    exact zero_le_one
  rw [← Finset.sum_singleton (f ·  x) i]
  apply le_trans _ (f.sum_le_one' x)
  rw [finsum_eq_sum (f ·  x) (by exact?)]
  simp only [Finite.toFinset_setOf, ne_eq]
  gcongr with z hz
  rw [Finset.eq_of_mem_singleton hz]
  simp only [Finset.mem_filter, Finset.mem_univ, true_and]
  exact h0
```
+a few golfs sprinkled in (untested)

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨g, hgs, hgt, (hicc : 0 ≤ g x ∧ g x ≤ 1)⟩ := exists_continuous_zero_one_of_isCompact hs ht hd
```

```suggestion
    constructor <;> linarith
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma toFun_eq_coe : f.toFun = f := rfl
```
(sorry!)

```suggestion
  have hVU' i : V i ⊆ U i := subset_closure.trans (hVU i)
```

```suggestion
      (v.subset_iUnion (Set.mem_of_mem_inter_left hx))
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    exact ⟨(hicc x).2, (hicc x).1⟩
```

```suggestion
    simpa [and_comm] using hicc x
```
hopefully works?

```suggestion
  have hsupp i : support (f i) ⊆ V i := support_subset_iff'.2 (hf0 i)
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/PartitionOfUnity): add variations of partition of unity for locally compact T2 space

source.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/linearRieszMarkovKakutani) prove that the Riesz content is indeed a content
